attributes.action: Make mandatory that vehicle manufacturers install remotely activated immobiliser
attributes.background: To assist with vehicles that 'fail to stop' for police and being used as weapons in terror attacks, all vehicles should be fitted with remotely activated immobilisers which can be activated by authorities or owners if thier vehicle is stolen or used in crime.
attributes.additional_details: This will help prevent the many deaths we have seen in police pursuits and vehicles being used as weapons in recent terror attacks.

attributes.action: Ban exams, instead get graded for classwork.
attributes.background: Because many people have anxiety, and this would help them from getting through this. Usually children to much better in class than under exam conditions.

attributes.action: Amend Hate Speech Laws
attributes.background: "Hate Crime is any criminal offence [...] which is perceived to be motivated by hostility or prejudice." Law enforcement will find it difficult to fully determine the motivations behind the speech or actions. As such, the law should be changed to "proven to be motivated by" to avoid ambiguity.

attributes.action: Update the Fatal Accidents Act 1976 to help bereaved families.
attributes.background: The loss of a loved one following a fatal injury (accident or murder) drastically needs updating. We need to expand the number of family members who are entitled to a bereavement award and to increase the compensation which currently stands at £12,980. The  Law tells us who is entitled to claim.
attributes.additional_details:
Why does it need updating...? 

A wife can claim £12,980 for loss of her husband but nothing if she loses an adult child. If a child loses a parent, the child receives nothing. 

However celebrities can obtain over £200,000 for breach of privacy for phone hacking.

A person killed instantly in an accident or murdered is worth NOTHING.  

The cost of looking after a DOG is more than a bereavement award and more than life itself.

Please help bereaved families and children who have lost parents.

attributes.action: Make unpaid internships illegal, National Minimum Wage compulsory after 2 weeks.
attributes.background: Unpaid Internships are used by companies in the fashion & creative industry that are worth millions. This use of free labour is exploitative. It increases elitism and classism within the chosen roles and does not give everyone a fair chance to pursue their future career.
attributes.additional_details: In 2018 it is unbelievable that not just students, but graduates are forced to work for free for up to a year after graduating if they have selected an arts/fashion based subject. If these individuals do not live in London or have their parents to contribute to their income it can cost £1,019 monthly according to The Sutton Trust. The majority of these companies are worth millions and can afford labour at NMW. These individuals are exploited, with no income and no promise of future employment.

attributes.action: There should be centrally funded, free, total and complete care for the elderly
attributes.background: I want to free the elderly from the huge burden of trying to fund their own care at the end of their lives.
attributes.additional_details:
I want to free the local authority from the burden of trying to fund care of the elderly when they do not have the money
I want to free the families from the burden of having to make up any shortfall in funding in order to give their loved ones the complete care they need
I want to see some meaningful return for the taxes we have paid throughout our working lives
Finally, it is the mark of a civilised nation that the state safeguards and has a duty of care towards the elderly: the most vulnerable In our society

attributes.action: Action an effective NHS care pathway for patients with Ehlers Danlos Syndrome
attributes.background: EDS is an inherited connective tissue abnormality.People with EDS have no care within the NHS. Healthcarer's have no access to formal training, forcing patients to self fund private care with the few specialists available, in order to manage their multiple,painful & life threatening disabilities.
attributes.additional_details:
EDS UK and the Royal College of GP's are working together to improve education on EDS and to create a 'toolkit' for GP's managing patients with the condition. (https://www.ehlers-danlos.org/news/spotlight/). 

At present, patients like myself are forced to fundraise for urgent and long term care to manage disabilities, extreme pain, dislocations, and at times life saving surgeries abroad. No specialist area has claimed the condition leaving GP's unaware of who to refer patients to for their care

attributes.action: Mandatory for all alcoholic beverages to display nutritional information
attributes.background: I suffer with type 1 diabetes but want to lead a normal life. Identifying the total carbohydrate content of a beer from various internet searches is difficult and unreliable. Furthmore we have a nation of growing waistbands, shouldn't the calorific content of alcohol be visible to inform consumers?

attributes.action: Change the way the dangerous dogs act is administered
attributes.background: Instead of dogs being unfairly imprisoned based on a non confirmed act of aggression, have the authorities act upon this in a timely manner to prevent stress to the animal. This stress is unjustified and an act of cruelty towards animals where the animal where there is evidence to the contrary.
attributes.additional_details: I write this based on a personal experience where a family dog has been in custody of an animal shelter based on false allegations. There is evidence to show the allegations are false yet the authorities are not acting upon this in a timely manner. The stress this causes to an animal is astronomical and should be deemed as cruelty which is unlawful. I call for the government to place a time frame on when cases are heard in court or for legislation to be brought forward to review evidence sooner.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for teachers to search students' phones without consent.
attributes.background: Ever since 2011 it has been legal for teachers to search through students’ phones without the consent of the student. Students are human as well, and just because we are on school grounds does not mean we should lose our rights - unconsented searches are a complete violation of our rights to privacy
attributes.additional_details: Teachers can search through student’s phones with little more information than someone saying something to the teacher. This is completely ridiculous and happened recently at a school - where boys were forced to hand over their phones for the teacher to go through, despite the fact that what the teacher was insinuating had not happened and they had no more evidence to go through the phone other than a meaningless accusation. This is a violation of our privacy - and should not be allowed.

attributes.action: Make branding or freeze branding of animals a criminal offence in the UK
attributes.background: Many horses and cattle in the UK are branded using heated iron or frozen metal (freeze branding). This is cruel, causing severe pain and is unnecessary when micro-chipping is cheap and quick. It could even be made illegal without new legislation by enforcing existing anti-cruelty laws.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information
https://www.rspca.org.uk/adviceandwelfare/pets/horses/health/identification
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/farm-animals/cows/dairy-cows/

attributes.action: Giving the British people the right to remove members of the Lords by petition.
attributes.background: I want to start this petition because some of the unelected members of the Lords are ignoring the will of the British people and acting in their own interests. There is no participation by the British people in who is appointed to the Lords. In a real democracy there should be a way to remove them .
attributes.additional_details: I help run a large Community Hall and a significant number of the membership when asked about the interference of the Lords into the EU referendum cannot understand why they are not answerable to anyone.

attributes.action: Divert the money used for foreign aid to fund the NHS as a temporary measure.
attributes.background:
Diverting overseas aid may seem wrong but we have many UK citizens of many ethnic backgrounds who are suffering because of lack of funding to the NHS and many of our citizens are dying needlessly.
The aid funding can be restored once we have put the NHS back on a proper footing.

attributes.action: Add miscarriges into the secondary school sex education national curriculum
attributes.background: Last year I had two miscarriges (6 & 9 weeks). I felt so alone & was given limited information in the form of a leaflet from NHS staff. Everyone I told said ‘it happens to lots of women’, ‘at least you know you can conceive’ No one previously warned me about miscarriges or the signs and symptoms.
attributes.additional_details: I feel that miscarriages should be a part of the national curriculum to educate both boys and girls on how and why it happens and the emotional and physical toll it can take on both parents. It is such a taboo subject and yet if so many women experience it why don’t we talk about it so no one feels alone or unsure of their symptoms.

attributes.action: Ban private parking firms from operating within the NHS.
attributes.background: I recently had to spend a lot of time visiting my ill mother in hospital. It opened my eyes to the fact so many people have huge worries regarding parking to see to their loved ones as the cost is so high. The worst bit about it is not a penny was going back into the hospital but to a private firm.
attributes.additional_details:
The gov website states:
Charges should be reasonable for the area.
Concessions, including free or reduced charges or caps, should be available for the following groups:
Disabled people
Frequent outpatient attenders
Visitors with relatives who are gravely ill, or carers of such people
Visitors to relatives who have an extended stay in hospital, or carers of such people
Carers of people in the above groups where appropriate.
My recent visits of £18 per day is certainly not within these guidelines.

attributes.action: Make ice cream van drivers pass a DBS check before attaining a trading license
attributes.background: Some ice cream drivers have been abusing their position by grooming and sexually abusing children. Let’s make our children and communities safe. Click the links in “more details” for some articles, google it and you’ll sadly find more. Make it legislation they must pass a DBS check prior to trading.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/news/liverpool-news/wirral-ice-cream-seller-jailed-5373318.amp

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/wfla.com/2017/10/30/man-who-sells-ice-cream-in-bradenton-arrested-for-sexually-assaulting-6-year-old-girl/amp/

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/amp.fox13news.com/news/local-news/ice-cream-man-accused-of-molesting-6-year-old-girl

attributes.action: Withhold all contractual payments to the EU untill a Brexit deal is reached.
attributes.background:
If the UK thrives after Brexit, the EU is doomed.

I believe that's why the EU is making things difficult, but, we too can make things difficult by withholding the huge amounts of money we pay them until a Brexit deal is reached.

EU members are allowed to leave. Thier behaviour is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Create NHS teams for the atypical patients & Stop them falling through the gaps!
attributes.background: I have spent my life living with complex illnesses, and this coupled with also having a rare illness, I have found myself falling through the gaps in the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
Because my situation and symptoms are ‘atypical’  I have spent the last few years being passed around in the system to different departments and teams, but never being taken on by their services as I do not meet the criteria or “fit in their box”. This has been made worse by the funding crisis, as no one is prepared to take on the atypical cases.

I propose the creation of specialist multi-disciplinary teams to take on the atypical cases, so that no one also falls through the gaps in the system.

attributes.action: Post study work visa should be introduced again for tier4 international students
attributes.background: Post study work visa was valid till 2012. Now winning a lottery might be an easy task for an international student  ( that too is not a good example because of no public funds clause) but getting a job with tier 2 specifications is a nightmare for the students who arrive here on loans and much more.

attributes.action: Prevent the MOD from cutting Operational Allowance for our Armed Forces
attributes.background: Operational Allowance has compensated our Armed Forces for the additional dangers of serving in countries like Afghanistan and Iraq. The MOD is considering cutting this allowance. This will have a huge impact upon morale of those deploying or about to deploy and their families, and must be stopped.

attributes.action: Make it Legal where ‘Footballs’ are Being Kicked into Gardens can be Kept in Law
attributes.background: At this time the Law states that Balls must be returned which is Stupid as they just Repeat their actions causing Damage to Plants and Property, they never Learn but the Loss would stop there actions, this can be from the Highway as Well as joining Gardens, there are Play Areas made for Football.
attributes.additional_details: The Police fail to uphold the Law from the Highways using section 161 item 3, Parents and their Children need to Learn either the easy way which they control or the hard way where they loose the Balls, we have had over Fifty balls over now with Nobody doing anything, cars damaged and garden lights smashed, the wife being hit in the face plus many other Antisocial things, the Police should not take their side and threaten Prosecution if house owners keep the Balls, Let’s put the issue correct Now

attributes.action: Stop charging married women to have their surname changed on their passport
attributes.background: When people get married and wish to take their partners surname the UK government charges to have their surname changed. This discriminates against marriage and women in particular as it is normally this sex which takes the surname of their partner. The charge should be eliminated or greatly reduced

attributes.action: Protect more of our countryside and seas by creating more conservation zones.
attributes.background: Disappearing habitat,destructive means of fishing by trawling, aquaculture in estuaries, pesticides in farming all harming our environment.

attributes.action: Utility companies to be responsible for repairing potholes around poor repairs
attributes.background: A majority of potholes form around places of existing weakness, such as road repair works following companies digging up the roads for routine maintenance.  These companies should be responsible for filling any potholes that are a consequence of a road weakness following their actions
attributes.additional_details:
Potholes are caused when water penetrates cracks in the road. When this water freezes, it expands, widening the cracks. When it melts, traffic smashes new craters into the road surface.  Other countries do not have many drains and services under their roads, and do not give privatised utility companies the right to dig up a new road
An increasing number of road users are taking legal action. The AA estimates that the cost to insurers of claims (pothole damage) was £2.85m during February alone.

attributes.action: UK govt to build a ship which can remove and recycle plastic from the oceans
attributes.background:
There are "islands" of plastic in our oceans which are 1- dangerous to marine life;  2- polluting our world; 3- a waste of resources
4- a human problem.
The UK govt could lead the world by building a ship which can collect the plastic, process it and bring to the UK to reuse the plastic
attributes.additional_details:
Ecological - There are millions of tons of resources lying on the ocean, we put it there, we should retrieve it. 

Resource - The technology exists to collect and re-use that plastic resource (think of it like a natural resource which we can mine and exploit). We can build infrastructure projects with free plastic!

Britain was built on a sea-faring heritage. Post-Brexit, this is an opportunity to show that we still lead the world. 

Finally, why would you or any country say "no"?

attributes.action: Stop Myxomatosis killing wild Rabbits by developing a lifetime vaccine
attributes.background: Myxomatosis is cruel disease which millions of wild rabbits in the UK die from each year. It is not acceptable that such a disease is left unchecked due to it being released illegally in the UK in the 1950’s. Myxomatosis is pure torture for any wild rabbit infected.
attributes.additional_details: They suffer severe conjunctivitis that results in blindness, swelling in the head, ears, eyes and genitals, thick pus discharge from the nose (which makes it difficult to breathe), and lumps on the body for up to two weeks before they die; longer in many cases. Rabbits are sentient beings, who feel pain and suffer every bit as any other animal. I want the Government to actively discuss all the options open to it to combat/control this disease in the wild rabbit population.

attributes.action: Ban plastic cotton buds
attributes.background: The sale and manufacture of plastic-stemmed cotton buds is to be banned under new Scottish government plans. England should follow suit as the plastic stems of cotton buds kill 1000s of marine species every year along the coastline.
attributes.additional_details: If the Scottish government can take action and ban plastic being used to make cotton buds so can we. People flush plastic cotton buds down the toilet and many end up in the ocean and as a result they are washed up on our beaches. Not only is this devastating for ecosystems but also for the health of our beautiful coastline. With alternatives such as paper cotton buds available, there is really no need to use plastic.

attributes.action: Make health workers exempt from parking tickets when delivering a public service
attributes.background: Allow domiciliary carers, emergency services, District nurses and doctors to park on single or double yellow lines when carrying out a health service for the public in their own homes.
attributes.additional_details: Care workers,District nurse,emergency services&doctors find it difficult to park when delivering a care service.if they display a notice,when parked on yellow lines, explaining they're there for a reason,they should be exempt from parking tickets within a certain time frame.The health services are under massive constraints&strains&are extremely limited to time,Parking issues need to be addressed. Councils pay for care to be delivered but penalise those very people when parking is unavailable.

attributes.action: Help me to deport my little brother from a Singaporean prison back to the UK
attributes.background: In the November of 2016 19 year old Lorenzo Dentamaro, was arrested in Singapore on accusations of fraud. He spent 6 months on bail battling the case only to be made an example of and harshly served with 3 years inprisomment. He is currently in 16 man cell, suffering in 30 plus temperatures.
attributes.additional_details: My family is suffering, I have grandparents that are very old and may never have the opportunity to see him again. We have to travel 13 hours to see him for only 20 minutes and I just want to bring him back home so he can complete his sentence in the UK. My mother is depressed, our lives have been impacted serverely and I am constantly living on breaking point. I just want to bring him home.

attributes.action: Reverse UK Sport decision not to fund badminton
attributes.background: UK Sport withdrew funding from Badminton for the next Olympics and restored approximately 10% of this funding back. In contrast around 30 million of funding was given to athletes for winter sports. We petition the government to restore funding to Badminton for the next Olympics.
attributes.additional_details: Badminton is the most popular indoor sports in the UK and is one of the few sports that can be played all year round in the UK. Winter sports is not a common sports in UK as the weather conditions and facilities are not conducive to it. It is limited in its availability to masses. If proper funding is available, badminton is much more likely to yield Olympics medals and also motivate the younger generation to participate in a sport that is readily available to them.

attributes.action: New drivers to have black box with continuous speeding reported to the police
attributes.background: Most new drivers today think they are invincible on the roads. All black boxes do at the moment is record excessive speeding to the car insurance companies that use them. Why are these behaviours not reported to the police and why are drivers not punished for this behaviour?
attributes.additional_details: It should be mandatory that all new drivers have a black box for their first year of driving, with all continuous excessive speeding data sent to the police. Police should deal with this behaviour the same as if they caught the driver themselves, via a driving awareness course or points. Black boxes shouldn’t be limited to just cars either, they should be on all road legal transportation. This could not only potentially save lives, but save money on insurance in the long run too.

attributes.action: "Warning" labels on dog flea shampoos containing Pyrethrum as toxic to cats.
attributes.background: I washed my cat with dog flea shampoo. There was no warning label on the product. In small writing amongst other text it stated it should never be used on cats. Unfortunately, my beloved companion died 2 days later. This type of poisoning is not uncommon.
attributes.additional_details: The product I used was a standard dog flea shampoo purchased over the counter for my dog weeks beforehand, but I didn't think it would be harmful to my cat.  Clear, informed "Warning" labels should be on the front of such products indicating they are toxic to cats. This will hopefully prevent other cats from being harmed or dying as a result of the chemical Pyrethrum which they can't metabolise, yet dogs can.

attributes.action: Make it a crime to remove dairy calves' teats without anaesthetic & pain relief
attributes.background: Many dairy calves have extra or "supernumerary" teats removed with a scalpel or scissors. It is only "recommended" to provide anaesthetic. Not legally required to provide anaesthetic and pain relief medication afterwards
attributes.additional_details:
For more information see the following links
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235188/Welfare-sheet-Dairy-cows.pdf
http://adlib.everysite.co.uk/adlib/defra/content.aspx?id=000IL3890W.182WIKRB434ZN7
http://www.gov.scot/Publications/2009/06/18114130/10

attributes.action: Make councils set up payment plans for parking tickets instead of total payment
attributes.background: Make it so councils have to let people pay fines in installmemts for people who can’t afford to pay in a lump sum for parking tickets. Instead of passing it to private bailiff firms who add more costs and won’t accept an affordable payment plan until their fees have been added on.
attributes.additional_details: I had a parking ticket which I couldn’t pay in a lump sum.  The council wouldn’t let me pay in installmemts so it got passed to the bailiffs and more charges put on. Then they came and clamped my van I use for self employed work and removed it after they were told it was for my business and valued under £1350. I have a 7 year old child who I can not get to school anymore and I have no income now and have complained and appealed but still no van. I made payments but they wanted £80 a month.

attributes.action: Change the Numeracy and Literacy Skills Tests to unlimited attempts
attributes.background: All trainee teachers have to sit numeracy and literacy skills tests in order to achieve Qualified Teacher Status. This should be changed from 3 attempts to unlimited attempts. Currently after 3 failed attempts the candidate cannot take these tests again for another 2 years.
attributes.additional_details: Each question from the mathematics section is timed putting a huge amount of pressure on trainee teachers. The maths and literacy skills tests should be revised and adapted depending on the age of the children the candidate wants to work with. For example primary and secondary trainee teachers should sit different tests, with the secondary teaching test being harder as the level of teaching required would be more challenging due to GCSE's.

attributes.action: Set the living wage age bracket to 21 and over
attributes.background: At the age of 21 you are regarding as an adult. You pay the same rates as a person 25+ and receive no tax reduction, discount on food/petrol/electricity/mortgage bills, etc. Why then, does the living wage only apply to the 25 and overs? Help the younger home owners and families live and provide.
attributes.additional_details:
Speaking from a personal perspective, my partner and I have 2 cars on finance, own a house and have started a family. Why should we not be entitled to the living wage?

At the age of 16 you are permitted to have a child and be expected to provide. At 17 you can drive and own a car, which needs upkeep. At the age of 18 you can buy a home which come with bills and expenses.

To discriminate on age is unacceptable. The government does not know an individuals curcumstance.

attributes.action: Justice for Zainab! Put pressure on the Pakistani government to act on rape.
attributes.background: Zainab is a 7 year old girl who was abducted when on her way to her Islamic lessons. She was raped and murdered and left in a pile of rubbish. Her parents were away on Ummrah when this had happened. Action needs to be taken! Pressure needs to be put on the Pakistani government to take rape seriously
attributes.additional_details: Put pressure on the government to introduce sexual abuse awareness to children! What is appropriate and what is not.

attributes.action: Restrict child benefit to the first two children in a family
attributes.background: The population of the world generally and of the UK specifically is growing at an alarming rate. The government should not be subsidising parents who choose to have larger families. It is therefore proposed that child benefit should be capped at two children per family

attributes.action: Pets in pet shops need to be in bigger and better tanks/cages. It’s just cruel.
attributes.background: Everyday you see rodents, such as hamsters, cavies, rabbits just stuck in tiny glass cages with little to no movement...and it is awful. I’d really like the legal cage requirements to be doubled as it breaks my heart seeing them in that condition

attributes.action: Enable ILR for Tier 2 Established Staff Visa which was issued before April 2011
attributes.background: As per the current rules, Tier 2 ICT Visa holders which was issued before April 2010 are eligible for ILR. In April 2010, rules have been changed and Tier 2 ICT Visa was given with the name as Established-Staff until April 2011. This Visa can be extended any number of times but not eligible for ILR.
attributes.additional_details: The rules have been changed again in 2011 to restructure the Tier 2 ICT Visas. Under these rules, Tier 2 ICT Visa holders who obtain Visa after April 2011 are eligible for settlement. This petition is for enabling ILR after completion of 5 years for Established-staff category Visa holders. As this Visa holders stayed in the country for more than 6 years, but not eligible for ILR under 5 year route. The number Visas issued between April 2010 and 2011 are very less and few people are remaining in the country right now. So, please enable ILR for Established staff category Visa holders under 5 year rule.

attributes.action: - To send aid to the people of Yemen and raise awareness
attributes.background: There is a war, a war we have all forgotten about. The Yemeni civil war is crushing its people and causing all kinds of ill fate, from starvation, illnesses and death. This forgotten war cannot stay in the dark.

attributes.action: Add red hair colour to the protected characteristics of the Equality Act.
attributes.background: Stop cruel comments with insinuations that being a red head is unfortunate ugly and embarrassing.That a person deserves to be bullied because there a red head.
attributes.additional_details: Taunting red heads seems to be the last socially accepted freebie in society, yet it's impact can be as devastating to the receiver as any person covered in the discrimination act. Abuse ranges from name calling which leads to low self esteem and depression. Most disturbing suicide. Serious assaults have occurred just for being a red head. A red head can't change the colour of hair. Like a person can't change their skin colour, sexual orientation or disability.  It can't continue. It's not "OK".

attributes.action: Cut Foreign Aid to £2B and use the balance for UK Defence and Public Services.
attributes.background: The Foreign Aid budget of  0.7% of GDP is an arbitrary target which sees the UK actually borrow money to then give it away to foreign countries. At a time of such worldwide insecurity, this money would be much better spent on the UK's Armed Forces and on helping the NHS & other Public Services.

attributes.action: Make banks reduce affordability criteria for mortgages for first time buyers.
attributes.background:
Affordability criteria with banks is currently around 3-4 times salary with adjustments for expenses. 

Even with Help-to-Buy, a person on the current living wage would have a £30,000 deficit on the 75% mortgage they would need to afford a £150,000 property.
attributes.additional_details:
The current affordability criteria makes it impossible for a single person to afford their own home. 

Banks are still making large profits, yet they seem unwilling to increase their risk in order help hardworking people afford their own place to live. 

Using mortgage calculators for a required amount, buyers see amounts which they feel they could afford, yet the affordability criteria excludes them from applying. 

This petition proposes banks meet the 75% regardless of salary for Help-to-Buy.

attributes.action: To move Parliament to new buildings more suitable for 21st century Britain
attributes.background: To look at building a new Houses of Parliament, more suitable for a 21st century Britain, that shows clearly, MPs are public servants, elected by the people, to serve the people. The current premises are alien to a modern, successful country
attributes.additional_details: The current Houses of Parliament will make a fantastic British historic building to open up for the public, will pay for itself in visitors and events.

attributes.action: Improve safety and quality of our road network and reduce congestion
attributes.background: 1.Starting in driving schools by ensuring there is more attention on teaching safe driving on motorways and dual carriage ways. We think that driving on these types of roads requires techniques that are not well emphasised by current training methods.
attributes.additional_details:
Improvement could be achieved if new drivers would be taught of correct speed selection, acceleration and keeping left when not overtaking. 
2.Improving existing roads by installing more signs to remind drivers of simple rules such as:
-Keep left when not overtaking (middle lane hogging)
-Keep your distance

attributes.action: Only allow fireworks on Firework night and New Years Eve due to pets rights.
attributes.background: I believe it is wrong that fireworks are released for days before and days after both Fireworks night and New Years Eve. This can scare pets and cause them to be unable to move from a position or relieve themselves outside. This is against their rights under the five freedoms, so should be illegal.
attributes.additional_details: This can also cause animals to run away from owners, or bolt when on walks, and so can leave owners devastated, and can lead to deaths and injuries to these animals. This can cause both emotional, physical and financial damage to the owners and public, along with emotional and physical damage to pets.

attributes.action: Make flashing front and/or rear lights on pedal bicycles illegal.
attributes.background: I am a professional driver. In the last couple of years there has been a rise to epidemic proportion of pushbikes on the roads which are displaying flashing lights. Some of which are so intense that they actually cause serious discomfort and distraction to other road users. These lights are a danger
attributes.additional_details: If every road user were to have a constantly flashing light then there would be many accidents as a result. Also with the advances in LED technology even those front lights which do not flash are blinding if the beam is set at an incorrect angle. People should have compulsory education regarding safe use of pushbikes.

attributes.action: Ban Fines for Parking Ticket Mistakes
attributes.background:
Honest people who have purchased valid parking tickets are being fined because of genuine mistakes - such as accidentally mistyping number plates in car parks that use number plate recognition. 

The British Parking Association know this - but their appeal system but offers no help.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition has nothing to do with fines for overstaying or not purchasing a ticket - this is for genuine mistakes.

Typically people have a single character wrong on their ticket - and still appeals side with the car park owners.

To anyone else - it would be clear that the driver had made a genuine mistake, and paid the correct amount for the time allocated.

This money making on genuine mistakes should be stopped.

A typing error should not cost someone £60+

attributes.action: To make it easier for grandparents to get parental Responsibility
attributes.background: Fathers, same sex parents and step parents can get PR by downloading the form and taking it to the local court to be witnessed and signed and that’s it they have PR.
attributes.additional_details: Grandparents have to get mediation and then apply to the family court for permission to apply for a residence order or special guardianship order which can all take months. How can this be right over 200,000 grandparents are bringing up one of more of their grandchildren. I realise children have to be protected and made safe but making it this hard for grandparents to get PR is not doing this.
